sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 72 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C72, the alternating group A4 × C3 × C2, or one of the 51 non-abelian groups of order 72.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 72 exist, and what are they?
message_2:
There are 10 non-isomorphic groups of order 72. They are as follows:

1. Z_72 (cyclic group of order 72)
2. Z_36 × Z_2
3. Z_24 × Z_3
4. Z_12 × Z_6
5. Z_8 × Z_9
6. Z_4 × Z_4 × Z_3 × Z_3
7. Z_4 × Z_18
8. Z_6 × Z_12
9. Z_3 × (Z_4 × Z_4 × Z_3) (semi-direct product)
10. Z_3 × (Z_8 × Z_9) (semi-direct product)

These groups can be found using the structure theorem for finite abelian groups and considering possible semi-direct products.
